section.title: Summary of changes
section.para: This section lists the changes of The &product; Administrator Guide.

listitem.para: The retry_sql_inserts option has been renamed to retries to increase consistency.

The default ports of the syslog drivers have been corrected.
Erroneous references to RFC5427 and RFC5428 have been removed.
New configuration objects called junctions and channels are available to improve the flexibility of configuring &abbrev;. For details, see and .
&abbrev; can publish messages using the AMQP (Advanced Message Queuing Protocol). For details, see .
The tcp, tcp6, udp, and udp6 drivers have been merged into a single network() driver. For details, see and .

The tcp, tcp6, syslog, and network source and destination drivers support the new tcp-keepalive-time(), tcp-keepalive-probes(), and tcp-keepalive-intvl() options. For details, see respective source and driver descriptions, for example, .
Objects can be defined inline as well. This is useful if you use the object only once (for example, a filter). For details, see .
The mongodb() destination supports using replicasets, sockets, and safe-mode. For details, see , , and , respectively.
The value-pairs() option can modify the names of the value-pairs using the rekey option. For details, see .
A new parser is available to explicitly parse messages as syslog messages. For details, see .
A new parser is available to parse JSON-formatted messages. For details, see .
The following new macros are available in : AMPM, HOUR12, LOGHOST, MSEC, SYSUPTIME, USEC.
The following new template functions are available in : GEOIP, LENGTH, STRIP, SUBSTR, TFHASH, UUID, and functions for various numerical operations.
The following new parsers are available in : @EMAIL@, @HOSTNAME@, @MACADDR@, @LLADDR@, @PCRE@, @SET@.
Actions triggered from the pattern database can use the number of messages as a condition. For details, see .
Messages triggered from the pattern database can inherit the properties of the original message. For details, see .
Tags can be added and deleted using rewrite rules. For details, see .
The file-template() and proto-template() global options have been documented. For details, see and , respectively.
The dbd-option() and session-statements() options are available for the sql() driver. For details, see and .
The tags and name-value pairs set in a pattern database file can be listed using the pdbtool dictionary command. For details, see .
The expect-hostname source flag has been documented.
The --caps command-line option has been documented. For details, see .
The reload option is available for the syslog-ng-ctl utility. For details, see .
Wildcards can be used to include multiple configuration files. For details, see .
